Yes, here are some resources and support groups for foster parents who want to adopt children with special needs:

1. National Adoption Center: This organization provides resources, support, and training for foster parents who are adopting children with special needs. Their website contains a wide range of information regarding the adoption process, including financial resources and legal guidance.

2. AdoptUSKids: This organization provides resources for families seeking to adopt children with special needs, including adoption home study services, training, and support groups.

3. Parent to Parent USA: This organization provides support for families who have children with special needs. They offer a database of trained parent mentors who can provide support and guidance to families in need.

4. The National Foster Parent Association: This organization provides resources and support for foster parents across the United States, including those who are adopting children with special needs.

5. The Arc: This organization is dedicated to improving the lives of individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. They offer resources, advocacy, and support for families and individuals with special needs.

6. Family Voices: This organization provides support and advocacy for families of children and youth with special healthcare needs. They have a national network of family-led organizations that focus on pediatric healthcare policy and advocacy.

There are also many local and regional organizations that provide resources and support for adoptive families of children with special needs. It may be helpful to search for organizations in your area that can provide support and connect you with other families who are going through similar experiences.
